title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1275 - Miscellaneous
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1275 - Miscellaneous

State Regulations
§ 1275.1 - Pedestrian travel restricted
§ 1275.2 - Entry into restricted areas prohibited
§ 1275.3 - Entry upon ramp and apron areas restricted
§ 1275.4 - Enplaning or deplaning passengers restricted
§ 1275.5 - Permission to post or distribute printed matter required
§ 1275.6 - Permission for solicitation of funds required
§ 1275.7 - Unauthorized commercial activity, entertainment and solicitation of alms prohibited
§ 1275.8 - Loitering prohibited
§ 1275.9 - Carrying of firearms and explosives restricted
§ 1275.10 - Interference, tampering or unauthorized starting of aircraft prohibited
§ 1275.11 - Cleaning and maintenance of aircraft restricted to designated areas
§ 1275.12 - Trash and garbage disposal restricted
§ 1275.13 - Responsibility for removal of spilled substances
§ 1275.14 - Entry of animals restricted
§ 1275.15 - Use of certain areas of terminal restricted

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1275

Statutory authority: N.Y. Laws 1921, ch. 154, art. VI and
N.J. Laws 1921, ch. 151, consented to by Congress 42 U.S. Stat. 174 [1921]; N.Y. Laws 1922, ch. 43 and N.J. Laws 1922, ch. 9, consented to by Congress 42
U.S. Stat. 822 [1922]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
